TEXT: The applicants PERSON and PERSON are NORP nationals , born in DATE and in DATE respectively and living in ORG ( ORG ) . They are represented before the ORG by PERSON Marzo , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by ORG , co - agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicants own CARDINAL plots of land in the municipality of Sannicola , recorded on the cadastral register as folio no . CARDINAL , parcel no . CARDINAL and no . CARDINAL . The former plot has been classified under LAW of DATE as a protected landscape ( “ vincolo paesistico monumentale ” ) and consequently can not be used for building . The second plot however has been classified as land that can be used for building tourist residences ( “ turistico residenziale ” ) .
On DATE , the applicants submitted a plan for the division of the plots ( “ piano di lottizzazione ” ) to ORG .
On DATE the applicants sent ORG a warning letter ( “ diffida ” ) by which they asked for a reply .
On DATE the applicants applied to ORG ( “ T.A.R. ” ) , maintaining that ORG had the duty to reply to their request of DATE .
By judgment of DATE , ORG ordered ORG to reply to the applicants’ request .
In the meantime , ORG had adopted PERSON No . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE which regulated the use of lands .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicants’ plan for the division of the plots on the ground that it was not consistent with the town - planning legislation and , in particular , with ORG of DATE and with LAW . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicants applied to ORG for compensation for damages as a result of the inertia by ORG in replying to their request . In particular , they alleged that if ORG had replied before the entry into force of Law No . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , their request would have been granted . Furthermore , they requested the court to state that the plan they had submitted to ORG was consistent with planning legislation in force at that time .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG declared the applicants’ claim inadmissible . The court first observed that only the regional administrative courts were competent to state whether a plan concerning the division of land was consistent with the planning legislation ; furthermore , it refused compensation stating that the applicants had not the right but a simple expectation to have their plan approved .
On DATE , the applicants appealed against the judgment to ORG .
By a judgment of DATE , ORG rejected the appeal and upheld the impugned judgment .
The applicants appealed on points of law .
By judgment of DATE , filed with the registry on DATE , ORG rejected the appeal .
